exprh.py¶

Contains a number of helper functions for sympy expressions represented as strings, sympy objects, or even latex.

exprh.process_prompt(prompt)[source]¶

Uses a number of helper functions to split the text from a prompt string and parse the remaining expression strings into sympy objects.

Parameters

prompt (str) – A string containing text and expressions within it.

Returns

A list containing the text and expressions from the original prompt string.

Return type

list(list, list)

exprh.replace(latex)[source]¶

A janky function that makes final substitutions on a latex string. A lazy solution to a complex problem.

Parameters

latex (str) – A latex string.

Returns

The cleaner version of the original latex.

Return type

str

exprh.secure(expr)[source]¶

Secures an expression string by helping prevent automatic simplifications being applied by a later call to to_sympy. Works by adding parentheses and adding zero to important expressions. These expressions are also raised to the power 1.

Parameters

expr (str) – A string that can be used to produce a sympy object by a call to to_sympy.

Returns

The original string with important expressions secured.

Return type

str

exprh.seperate(prompt)[source]¶

Seperates a prompt string into a list of text and a list of expression strings. Expressions in the prompt must be delimited by ‘{‘ and ‘}’. Note, to prevent latex expressions from being incorrectly parsed, they must be delimited by ‘$’ symbols. For intance ‘The angle is $frac{pi}{2}$’ would be valid.

Parameters

prompt (str) – A string containing text and expressions within it.

Returns

A list of text and a list of expression strings.

Return type

tuple(list, list)

exprh.subs(sympy_obj, substitutions)[source]¶

Substitutes values from a dictionary into a sympy object without applying any automatic simplifications.

Parameters

  • sympy_obj (sympy) – A sympy object.

  • substitutions (dict) – A dictionary of key value pairs that associate sympy symbols in the sympy object with values. Note that the keys must be sympy objects.

Returns

A sympy object with symbols replaced by values specified in subsitutions.

Return type

sympy.core.expr.Expr

exprh.to_sympy(expr)[source]¶

Converts an expression string into a sympy object. Superior to sympy.sympify because to_sympy can handle normal expressions as well as relations.

Parameters

expr (str) – A string that can be parsed into a sympy object.

Returns

The sympy object associated with the given string.

Return type

sympy
